Package edu.ncsu.csc316.dsa.tree

Interface BinaryTree<E>

  • Type Parameters:
    E - the type of elements stored in the binary tree
    All Superinterfaces:
    Tree<E>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractBinaryTree, LinkedBinaryTree
    public interface BinaryTree<E>
extends Tree<E>
    The Binary Tree abstract data type represents a hierarchical collection of elements, where each. The Binary Tree ADT restricts each node in the tree to have either 0, 1, or 2 children. All Binary Trees must be Iterable to allow clients to iterate using for-each loops. The Binary Tree interface is based on the implementation developed for use with the textbook: Data Structures and Algorithms in Java, Sixth Edition Michael T. Goodrich, Roberto Tamassia, and Michael H. Goldwasser John Wiley and Sons, 2014
    Author:
    Dr. King

      Returns a reference to the new tree position that is created to store the given element.
      java.lang.Iterable<Position<E>> inOrder()
      Returns an Iterable collection of positions that represent the inorder traversal of positions within the tree
      Position<E> left​(Position<E> p)
      Returns the position that is the left child of the provided position, p
      Position<E> right​(Position<E> p)
      Returns the position that is the right child of the provided position, p
      Position<E> sibling​(Position<E> p)
      Returns the position that is the sibling of the provided position, p

    • Method Detail

      • addLeft

        Position<E> addLeft​(Position<E> p,
                    E element)
        Returns a reference to the new tree position that is created to store the given element. The newly created position is added as the left child of the provided position.
        Parameters:
        p - the position for which to add a new left child
        element - the element to add to the tree in the newly created position
        Returns:
        the position that is created as the left child of the provided position
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the position, p, does not represent a valid tree position
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the provided position already has an existing left child

      • addRight

        Position<E> addRight​(Position<E> p,
                     E element)
        Returns a reference to the new tree position that is created to store the given element. The newly created position is added as the right child of the provided position.
        Parameters:
        p - the position for which to add the new right child
        element - the element to add to the tree in the newly created position
        Returns:
        the position that is created as the right child of the provided position
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the position, p, does not represent a valid tree position
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the provided position already has an existing right child

      • inOrder

        java.lang.Iterable<Position<E>> inOrder()
        Returns an Iterable collection of positions that represent the inorder traversal of positions within the tree
        Returns:
        a collection of positions that represent the tree's inorder traversal

        Returns:

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the position, p, does not represent a valid tree position
